intro: Allantodia sunghsienensis, commonly known as the Shandong bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
